alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 13 at 7:22PM EDT until July 13 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Orange County in central Vermont... Rutland County in southern Vermont... Central Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 722 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Whiting to 13 miles south of West Pawlet, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Rutland, Chester, Woodstock, Killington, Ludlow Village, Rutland City, Wallingford, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Plymouth, Chittenden, West Rutland, Ira, West Castleton, Mount Holly, Poultney Village, Mount Tabor, Shrewsbury, Danby, Lake St. Catherine, and Bridgewater. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
